title: How Many Calories in a Halo Orange?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a halo orange, including carbs, fiber, protein, fat, and more from our detailed nutrition breakdown.
h1: How Many Calories in a Halo Orange?
assumptions: Average halo orange (mandarin/clementine variety, ~74 g edible portion), fresh, peeled, no added sugar or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, variety, and growing conditions. Check product labels for exact values when available.

quick_answer.text: One halo orange provides about 47 kcal and 1.7 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Eat two halo oranges instead of one

faqs.q: How many calories in a halo orange?
faqs.a: Approximately 47 kcal per average-sized halo orange.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a halo orange?
faqs.a: About 11.7 g total carbs, including 1.7 g fiber and 9.3 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is a halo orange low in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.2 g fat per orange, with no saturated or trans fats.

faqs.q: How does halo orange compare to other citrus?
faqs.a: Similar to a clementine; lower calories than a navel orange (about 69 kcal for medium).

faqs.q: Are halo oranges good for weight loss?
faqs.a: Yes, low-calorie snack with fiber for satiety; one orange is under 50 kcal.
